title: Looking for a ranged splitpusher who scales well
body: I'm having a hard time choosing a few main champions or a main role. I'm not an aggressive player and I hate  taking high risk decisions. As such I don't like the pressure of having to do well early and I don't like diving into the middle of team fights so I hate assassins and really any melee except the ones like GP who are back liners in team fights because of ranged abilities. However, I also like champions with enough self-sufficiency to be able to split push because low elo players just aram mid and I want to get away from the clown fiesta while collecting all the farm available and closing the game myself. What champions possess all those qualities and what role should I play?

replies.body: Well, {{champion:164}} and {{champion:114}} are both pretty self-sufficient and can get into range and out of range with ease. Both are good at split pushing as well, and in Camille's case good at engaging fights or picks.
How has no one recommended gnar yet?
Gnar isn't the best splitpusher, but he's really good rn. I would recommend picking him up too.
Sivir is really good at doing exactly what you describe.
Only good ones I think of are: {{champion:150}}  {{champion:74}}  and {{champion:18}}. And probably {{champion:115}} too.

They don't really have range, but {{champion:75}}  {{champion:83}} and {{champion:48}} have really nice split push and they are difficult to kill. You could also try {{champion:34}} if you don't mind playing mid, she's really safe and can just sit in lane farming indefinitely

{{champion:23}} 

If you can be patient and build on hit and Mallet then I suggest Keyser Soze himself... {{champion:17}}
